thread.title: CPI unlikely to threaten rate outlook
thread.title_full: CPI unlikely to threaten rate outlook

title: CPI unlikely to threaten rate outlook
text:
Wed, Jul 22, 2015, 7:08 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets open in 2 hrs 52 mins CPI unlikely to threaten rate outlook AAP – 1 hour 36 minutes ago Recommend Print 
As the nation's leaders try to thrash out the future shape of the federation, new figures will have a more immediate impact on Australians day-to-day lives. 
The latest official inflation figures will indicate how long we can expect interest rates to remain at record lows. 
Economists expect the consumer price index rose 0.8 per cent in the June quarter, reflecting a sharp rise in petrol prices, and lifting the annual rate to 1.7 per cent. 
This would still be comfortably below the Reserve Bank's two to three per cent inflation target. 
Underlying inflation, which excludes volatile price movements such as petrol, is forecast to rise 0.6 per cent for a relatively benign 2.2 per cent over the year. 
Such results suggest the central bank will keep the official cash rate at an all-time low of two per cent for a while yet - good news for borrowers, but not so good for savers. 
Premiers and chief ministers will be meeting in Sydney with Prime Minister Tony Abbott at a special leaders retreat, where changes to the GST are expected to be high on the agenda. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Petrol price spike to lift inflation AAP 
Inflation is expected to have remained in check despite a sharp rise in petrol prices, encouraging the Reserve …
